messages: 056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:00): Hi, anyone with ip stack source code knowledge online? I have a question about version differences in ip_input.c (1.1.1.1 vs. 1.229)
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:05): SevenIsPrime: well, if it's cvs
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:05): 1.1.1.1 is the first check in ever
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:05): and 1.229 is quite some time after that
056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:05): as documented in "Stevens", correct?
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:06): i have no idea who `Stevens' is
056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:06): Stevens, "TCP/IP isslustrated", Vol. 2 -- the implementation.
056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:06): illustrated of course ...
056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:07): the standard reference on TCP/IP
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:07): no, as documented in `how cvs works'
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (06:07): Try http://cvsbook.red-bean.com/cvsbook.html

563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:07): is there a way you can randomize the motd?  i hvae a script writen, i just dont know where to load it, i dont know where i can place it before it reads the static etc/motd file
056264e02fd66d191cf68e872ffcb965 (06:07): I meant version 1.1.1.1 of the code should be the one that is discussed in the book.
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:08): the script just selects one of the 5 motd files i have
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:08): randomized..
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:08): r_6: erm, i think there's a motd in rc.d
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:08): or you can stick it in rc.local or in a cron tab
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:08): is there?
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:08): gotcha..
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:08): so it switches on next reboot?
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:08): r_6: i've seen it say `setting up motd' on boot
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:09): r_6: if you stick it in cron 0 0 * * * /path/to/your/script
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:09): i figured that out in a way, i can get it to switch on reboot.. i just want to make it where it randomizes on login
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:09): will do it at midnight every day
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:09): ahhhhhhh i c..
c24781797c98640feb74dfa85104daaf (06:09): r_6: fortune(6) might provide some "interesting" MOTDs.
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:09): zero minutes past zero o'clock
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:09): are the stars there for a reason?.. or is that just showing path
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): yea. i was going to rip apart fortune.. and replace it with mine.. but that was a last resort :)
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:10): they're for day of month, month of year and day of week
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): foolish.. for a reason?.. or path.. im guessing path
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): gotcha
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): just using the wilcard then so it always does it
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:10): so on midnight of every day of the year
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): gotcha :)
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:10): r_6: man 5 crontab
563f50889f3d95ef151ba3a34bbda2eb (06:10): ty.. ill give her a try
79f92927311818b577140f17bbe88f72 (06:10): hey, there's a man page for that?
